data: ANES Fascial Plane Catheter (Module)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Restricted to Department of Anesthesiology
Admit to Acute Pain Service (APS) / Perioperative Pain Service (POPS) - See ANES Multi-Modal Pain Management PowerPlan
Patient Care
Communication Order

Do NOT give any Opioids, CNS Depressants, and other analgesics unless approved by the Acute Pain Service (APS) / Perioperative Pain Service (POPS) / Anesthesiology (EXCEPT in Critical Care Units: CSICU and ICU)
Communication Order
Epidural/perineural contraindicated if dose exceeds: enoxaparin 40 mg daily or dalteparin 5000 units daily or heparin 5000 units q8h
Communication Order
For patients receiving prophylactic subcutaneous enoxaparin up to 40 mg qdaily or dalteparin up to 5000 units qdaily or heparin up to 5000 units q8h
Remove Paravertebral Catheter
Remove paravertebral catheter as per protocol
Paravertebral Catheter Care
q4h, dressing dry and intact
Notify Treating Provider
T;N
Monitoring Orders are for Inpatient Ward
Vital Signs
q1h until stable, then q4h
Pulse Oximetry
q1h until stable, then q4h
Sedation Assessment
q1h until stable, then q4h
Pain Assessment
q1h until pain is well controlled and patient understands therapy then q4h
Motorsensory Assessment
q4h
Local Anesthetic Systemic Toxicity Assessment (LAST)
Assess for systemic side effects of local anesthetic q4h while awake
Neurovascular Assessment
q4h, assess nerve compression
Following Clinician / Provider Bolus Dose:
Pain Assessment
q15min for 30 minute or until stable then resume as previously ordered
Medications

Contact APS or Anesthesiologist if any anticoagulant, antiplatelet, or thrombolytic ordered.   EXCEPTIONS:  Prophylaxis doses of low molecular weight heparin (i.e. dalteparin 5000 units subcutaneous daily, enoxaparin 40 mg subcutaneous daily)   or heparin (i.e. heparin 5000 units subcutaneous BID to TID) while perineural catheter in situ
ROpivacaine 0.2% perineural PCPA and continuous- total volume

5 mL/h continuous rate, 0 mL/h minimum rate, 10 mL/h maximum rate, titrate instructions: Do not wean unless ordered, 5 mL PCA dose, 30 min PCA lockout interval, 70 mL 4-hour limit, 2 PCA doses/h max, pump type: CADD Solis, therapy: Paravertebral Surgical,
BUpivacaine 0.125% perineural PCPA and continuous- total volume
